body_html:
I still do not see why we may need your edit.
On windows, we clearlly should avoid using /tmp.
But your change makes all the statement a noop both on windows and linux, and it always returns /tmp/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed. This is definitely something we do not want.
body_text:
I still do not see why we may need your edit.
On windows, we clearlly should avoid using /tmp.
But your change makes all the statement a noop both on windows and linux, and it always returns /tmp/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed. This is definitely something we do not want.
body:
I still do not see why we may need your edit.
On windows, we clearlly should avoid using `/tmp`.
But your change makes all the statement a noop both on windows and linux, and it always returns `/tmp/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed`. This is definitely something we do not want.
